hazard.name: Sarracenia's Ire

stealth.notes: to recognize that the scene before them is an illusion.

description: As {@hazard Myristica's Despair|WoW1}.

entries: DC 22 {@skill Nature} (trained) to tame the primal energy, DC 24 {@skill Religion} (trained) to suppress the haunt, DC 25 {@skill Diplomacy} (trained) to console the dryad; three successes are required to disable the haunt.

actions.name: Awaken
actions.trigger: At least two creatures enter the grove
entries: The illusion fades, and a sorrowful chill emanates from the giant tree. The haunt rolls initiative.

routine: (1 action; {@trait emotion}, {@trait mental}, {@trait primal}) Sarracenia's rage overwhelms up to two living creatures in the grove, each of which must attempt a DC 23 Will save.

Success: The creature is unaffected.
Failure: The creature is {@condition confused} for 1 round.
Critical Failure: For 1 round, the creature is {@condition confused}, is {@condition stupefied||stupefied 1}, and gains a +4 status bonus to damage rolls.

reset: Unless {@creature Silene|WoW1} is destroyed, this {@trait haunt} can recharge itself after 1 hour.

hazard.name: Myristica's Despair

stealth.notes: to recognize that the scene before them is an illusion.

description: The illusion shatters, revealing the grove to be a lifeless scar and the seemingly peaceful loggers to be crawling aimlessly about the clearing, consumed by rage and lashing out at anything that comes near.

entries: DC 22 {@skill Nature} (trained) to tame the primal energy, DC 23 {@skill Diplomacy} (trained) to console the dryad, DC 24 {@skill Occultism} (trained) to identify and heal the emotional wounds; three successes are required to disable the haunt.

actions.name: Awaken
actions.trigger: At least two creatures enter the grove
entries: The illusion fades, and a sorrowful chill emanates from the giant tree. The haunt rolls initiative.

routine: (1 action; {@trait emotion}, {@trait mental}, {@trait primal}) Myristica bemoans her grove's fate, overwhelming foes with sorrow. Each creature in the grove must attempt a DC 23 Will save.

Success: The creature is unaffected.
Failure: The creature is {@condition dazzled} for 1 round and takes {@damage 2d6} mental damage.
Critical Failure: The creature takes {@damage 2d6} mental damage, plus {@damage 2d6} {@condition persistent damage||persistent mental damage}. While taking this {@condition persistent damage}, they are {@condition dazzled}.

reset: Unless {@creature Silene|WoW1} is destroyed, this {@trait haunt} can recharge itself after 1 hour.

hazard.name: Bee-Induced Panic
description: Enraged bees spread panic, causing the crowd to trample each other in a desperate attempt to escape.

entries: DC 22 {@skill Diplomacy} (expert) to calm the panicked crowd and guide them to safety, DC 20 {@skill Medicine} (trained) to attend to victims' injuries, or DC 21 {@skill Nature} (expert) to instruct the crowd on how best to protect themselves from bees. Alternatively, a PC able to communicate with insects can instead attempt a DC 18 {@skill Diplomacy} (trained) check to calm and redirect the bees. Three successful checks are required to completely disable the hazard. The hazard is automatically disabled after 5 rounds or once both swarms are defeated.

routine: {@as 3} Panicked attendees suffer stings and accidentally injure one another in their fear and confusion. Increase the Casualties score by 1. This increases to {@dice 1d3} if one swarm is stinging the crowd, and it increases to {@dice 1d3+1} if both swarms are stinging the crowd.

hazard.name: Rusty Floor Spikes
description: Pressure plates on the floor near the north door cause rusty spikes to lance up out of the floor in area {@b C3}.

entries: {@skill Thievery} {@dc 18} (trained) to disable the pressure plates.

actions.trigger: A creature steps on the pressure plate
entries: The spikes spring up, Striking all creatures in the hallway. The floor becomes greater difficult terrain.
actions.name: Spring Up

reset: Turn the resetting wheel in the eastern Inner Guard Station (area {@b C8b}).

hazard.name: Rusted Door
description: Shards of rust extend from the door and crumble away to cling to the flesh and clothes of anyone who attempts to open or damage the door.

entries: {@dc 18} {@skill Thievery} to deface the hidden runes that allow the trap to activate, or {@dc 21} {@skill Religion} to offer prayers to a non-evil deity to override the ancient influence of Xar-Azmak.

actions.trigger: A non-worshipper of Xar-Azmak attempts to open the door or causes damage to it with a melee {@action Strike}
entries: The triggering creature is exposed to {@disease rust creep|Rust} as tendrils of rust-red energy seem to slither out of the rusty patches on the door to rasp strangely gently against exposed skin.
actions.name: Inflict Rust Creep

reset: The rusted door resets automatically after 1 round.

hazard.name: Ancient Apparatus
description: A complex device made of multicolored metal that resembles a combination of grinding gears, spider-like legs, and twitching blades, from which emits a constant soft ticking sound. All of the metal in the device appears to be rusted or corroded.

entries: {@dc 18} {@skill Thievery}  to adjust the device's workings so they seize up and no longer function, or {@dc 21} {@skill Religion} to focus prayers to a non-evil deity into the device to disrupt its ability to channel ambient faith.

actions.trigger: The ancient apparatus takes damage or an attempt to disable it fails
entries: The ancient apparatus begins to grind and churn faster. Its soft ticking whirs up to a discordant buzzing sound, and the entire thing begins to glow with an unsettling rustcolored light. All living creatures in area {@b D3} experience the unsettling taste of rust in their mouths and must succeed on a {@dc 18} Fortitude save to avoid becoming {@condition sickened 1}. The ancient apparatus then rolls initiative.
actions.name: Spin Up

routine: (3 actions) The ancient apparatus emits beams of rust-colored light, spending an action to make ranged {@action Strike||Strikes} against three targets in area {@b D3}. The apparatus can target creatures as if it possessed darkvision, but has no ability to discern between friend or foe. It can't target a creature more than once, and if there are more than three targets, it selects its targets from those it can see in the room randomly. The ancient apparatus has only 1 action as long as its Hit Points are below its BT.
reset: The ancient apparatus reverts to its non-active mode and resets automatically at the end of any round in which there are no obvious targets to attack.

hazard.name: Rusted Cage Trap
description: A rusty cage embedded in the ceiling drops down with a clang to try to entrap a creature that steps onto the pressure plate in the middle of the room.

entries: {@dc 13} {@skill Thievery} to harmlessly trigger the trap by nudging the pressure plate, or {@dc 20} {@skill Thievery} to stabilize the pressure plate so it doesn't trigger, {@dc 20} {@skill Athletics} to {@action Escape} from the cage or {@action Force Open} the cage once it falls.

actions.trigger: A creature walks under the cage and steps on the pressure plate
entries: The cage drops from the ceiling to trap the triggering creature, who must attempt a {@dc 17} Reflex save.

Critical Success: The creature avoids the trap, and returns to the space it just left rather than entering the trap's space.
Success: As Critical Success, but the falling trap delivers a glancing blow and {@damage 1d6+3} bludgeoning damage to the creature as it stumbles back.
Failure: The falling trap lands on the triggering creature. A Medium or smaller creature becomes trapped inside the cage (Escape {@dc 20}). A Large or larger creature takes {@damage 2d6+5} bludgeoning damage and is knocked prone as the cage bounces off the creature's body, becoming destroyed in the process.
Critical Failure: As Failure, but a Medium or smaller creature is also struck by the cage, knocked prone, and then takes {@damage 2d6+5} bludgeoning damage and is immobilized by the cage as it lands on a limb.

reset: The mechanism to manually reset this trap is located in area {@b D15}.

hazard.name: Rusty Spike Launcher
description: As the large rusty door swings open, a mass of rusty spikes appear out of nowhere in the open doorway and launch violently into the room.

entries: {@skill Thievery} {@dc 20} to decouple the triggering rods that cause the spikes to extend, or {@spell dispel magic} (2nd level; counteract {@dc 18}) to counteract the trap.

actions.trigger: A creature opens the door without uttering a prayer to Xar-Azmak first
entries: A mass of rusty spikes appears in the open doorway and then fire into area {@b E1}. The rusty spikes curve through the air to seek targets—all creatures in area {@b E1} must attempt a {@dc 20} Reflex save.

Critical Success: The creature avoids the spikes and takes no damage.
Success: A spike grazes the creature, inflicting {@damage 2d10} piercing damage.
Failure: A spike impales the creature, inflicting {@damage 2d10+13} piercing damage.
Critical Failure: As failure, but the spike also exposes the creature to {@disease tetanus|GMG}.

actions.name: Launch Spikes

reset: The trap automatically resets once the door is closed.

hazard.name: Rushing Waters
description: Rivulets of water begin to run from the circle of stones to gather in a growing puddle at the center.

entries: {@skill Thievery} {@dc 20} (expert) to rub out the hidden runes on the ceiling, or {@spell dispel magic} (2nd level; counteract {@dc 18}) to counteract the trap.

actions.trigger: A creature enters the area south of the ring of stones marked on the map
entries: A deluge of water rises up from the ring of stones, then flows forcefully down the passageway to drain into the pit at area {@b F1b}. Large and smaller creatures in the water's path must attempt a {@dc 20} Fortitude save. The rushing waters vanish instantly upon striking the pit floor, but do leave everything down there sopping wet.

Critical Success: The creature withstands the force of the rushing waters and is unaffected.
Success: The creature takes {@damage 1d10} bludgeoning damage as the rushing waters slam them into a cave wall.
Failure: The creature is knocked prone by the rushing waters, takes {@dc 1d10+6} bludgeoning damage, and is pushed by the water to the spiky pit trap and triggers the trap.
Critical Failure: As failure, but the creature can't attempt to {@action Grab an Edge} if they fall into the spiky pit trap.

actions.name: Spherical Deluge

reset: The magic rejuvenates over 10 minutes, after which it is recharged and ready to activate again.

hazard.name: Spiky Pit Trap
description: A piece of hide covered with a layer of dirt and gravel is suspended over a 20-foot pit filled with spikes.

entries: {@dc 18} {@skill Thievery} (trained) to manually trigger the trap without falling in, or {@dc 25} {@skill Thievery} (trained) to secure the hide so the trap doesn't activate

actions.trigger: A creature or other large weight (such as the rushing waters of the previous trap) moves onto the gravel-covered hide
entries: The triggering creature or object falls in and takes falling damage (10 bludgeoning damage) and is targeted by a spike's {@action Strike}. A falling creature can attempt to {@action Grab an Edge} with a {@dc 20} Reflex save (this becomes a {@dc 22} Reflex save if rushing waters are pouring into the pit).
actions.name: Pitfall

reset: Creatures can still fall into the trap, but the hide that covers it must be reset manually (a 10-minute activity) for the trap to become hidden again.

hazard.name: Test of the God Caller
description: An incorporeal Sarkorian deity manifests before the party and challenges their resolve. Only aspirants whose motives are pure and whose hearts are in tune with the natural world can hope to overcome this "test of the god caller."

entries: Three DC 27 {@skill Nature} or {@skill Occultism} (trained) checks can disable the haunt

actions.name: Manifest
actions.trigger: Sakuachi makes an offering at the well shrine
entries: The Sarkorian deity inhabiting the well surges to life, manifesting as a large, ghostly beast surrounded by throngs of smaller animals. The rush of spiritual energy washes over everyone in the well, dealing {@damage 8d6} force damage (DC 25 basic Will save).

routine: (3 actions) The Sarkorian divinity commands a swarm of ghostly animals to overwhelm creatures in a 10-foot burst in the well. The haunt can select up to three different points to target, spending 1 action per burst. Creatures in an affected take {@damage 4d6} force damage and must attempt a DC 25 Will save. The haunt loses 1 action for each successful check to disable the haunt.

Success: The target takes half damage.
Failure: The target takes full damage and is {@condition flat-footed} until the beginning of the haunt's next turn.
Critical Failure: The target takes double damage, is {@condition flat-footed} until the beginning of the haunt's next turn, and is {@condition slowed||slowed 1} for 1 round.

reset: 8 hours

hazard.name: Toppling Shelves

stealth.notes: to notice the shelf's precarious instability

description: This stone bookshelf is badly compromised. It's just one push away from toppling over.

entries: DC 22 {@skill Thievery} (expert) or {@skill Lore||Engineering Lore} (trained) to shore up the shelf

notes.std: any attack that fails to destroy the shelf triggers its Topple reaction

actions.name: Topple
actions.trigger: The shelf is attacked or touched forcefully (such as by a creature Shoved into it)
entries: The shelf tumbles over in the direction opposite its triggering creature, crashing onto the ground in a 10-foot-by-10-foot area. Creatures in the area take {@damage 4d8+10} bludgeoning damage (DC 25 basic Reflex save). A creature that critically fails its save falls {@condition prone}. The affected area becomes difficult terrain.

If the toppling shelf crashes into a space occupied by another toppling shelf, it triggers that shelf's Topple reaction. This can result in a chain reaction that causes multiple shelves to Topple, one after the other.

hazard.name: Freezing Floor

stealth.notes: or DC 31 (master) to notice the cold fog rising from the floor

description: The white brick floor radiates ice-cold air.

entries: DC 24 {@skill Thievery} (expert) to erase a rune, or {@spell dispel magic} (3rd level; counteract DC 24) to dispel a rune; all three runes must be erased or dispelled to disable the trap.

notes.std: to destroy the bricks and disable the trap

actions.name: Cold Snap
actions.trigger: A creature steps on the white bricks
entries: The trap makes a frost jet {@action Strike} against the triggering creature and rolls initiative.

actions.name: Frostbite
entries: A creature that takes {@condition persistent damage||persistent cold damage} from the trap's frost jet {@action Strike} must attempt a DC 18 Fortitude save.

Critical Success: The creature isn't affected and is immune to this frostbite effect for 24 hours.
Success: The creature isn't affected.
Failure: The creature can't stop shivering and becomes {@condition clumsy||clumsy 1}.
Critical Failure: As failure, and the creature becomes {@condition fatigued}.

routine: (3 actions) With each action, the trap attempts a frost jet {@action Strike} against any creature standing on the white bricks. The trap loses 1 action per disabled or dispelled rune.
reset: The trap deactivates and resets after 1 minute.

hazard.name: Valmar's Pit Trap
description: The ground here is made of loosely packed soil that, when stepped upon, collapses.

entries: DC 22 {@skill Survival} (trained) to reinforce the dirt so it's safe to walk on, or DC 18 {@skill Thievery} (trained) to collapse the trap from a safe distance

actions.name: Collapse
actions.trigger: A creature steps onto any space in the dotted area on the map, or at least 30 pounds of pressure is put on the area
entries: The ground gives way. The triggering creature falls 20 feet down the hole, taking 10 bludgeoning damage and landing {@condition prone} in area {@b E10}. A creature can {@action Grab an Edge} to avoid falling.

reset: Creatures can still fall into the pit, but the soil must be replaced for the trap to become {@condition hidden} again.

hazard.name: Memory of Osoyo
description: The party's memories of Osoyo coalesce into a titanic mirage in the storm clouds above.

entries: DC 22 {@skill Occultism} (trained) or DC 24 {@skill Arcana} (trained) to divert the memory's rage; three total successful checks are required to disable the hazard

actions.name: Glacial Gust
actions.trigger: The characters' shared vision during Event 15 subsides
entries: The memory of Osoyo unleashes a tremendous sigh of freezing wind, coating the deck of the {@i Mermaid's Tears} in ice in a 60-foot cone. (The hazard can choose any point for the cone to originate.) The area becomes difficult terrain. Creatures in the area must succeed at a DC 26 Fortitude save or take {@damage 1d6} {@condition persistent damage||persistent cold damage} as the freezing wind cuts to the bone. The hazard then rolls initiative.

routine: (1 action) The memory of Osoyo gives a keening scream that shatters the layer of ice coating the deck of the {@i Mermaid's Tears}. Any creature on difficult terrain created by the memory's Glacial Gust takes {@damage 2d8+7} cold damage (DC 26 basic Reflex save) from the icy shrapnel.

hazard.name: Shroud of Silence
description: Sounds become muted in a 20-foot-wide, 100-foot-long segment of this street corridor.

entries: DC 25 {@skill Occultism} (expert) to twist the magic of the ley line around you, disabling the hazard for only you; or {@spell dispel magic} (4th level; counteract DC 23) to disable the hazard permanently

actions.name: Hush
actions.trigger: A creature reaches the street's halfway point
entries: Each creature in the affected area must succeed at a DC 23 Will saving throw or be silenced as long as it remains in the area. A silenced creature makes no sound and can't use abilities with the {@trait sonic} or {@trait auditory} traits, including spells with verbal components.

hazard.name: Unwelcome Facade
description: An unsettling wave of malice and sinister energy ripples invisibly out from the manor, causing those who view the building to see a leering, evil face glaring at them from the structure's architecture.

entries: {@dc 32} {@skill Occultism} or {@skill Religion} to exorcise the haunt, {@dc 35} {@skill Society} to approach the manor in a proper way that defers to its occupant's symbolic standing in the community; displaying an official pass that legally grants permission to enter the building reduces both of these DCs by 5 (provided the PCs approach the front door and not from another direction).

actions.name: Horrifying Vision
actions.trigger: A {@trait Small} or larger creature approaches within 30 feet of the house's exterior
entries: A wave of malice fills the minds of all living creatures outside of the manor within 60 feet with overwhelming fear; each creature must attempt a {@dc 29} Will save.

entries.Critical Success: The creature is unaffected and is temporarily immune to Horrifying Vision for 24 hours. In addition to this temporary immunity, the creature can attempt a {@dc 23} {@skill Occultism} or {@skill Religion} check as a free action to notice that despite there being only one face in the facade, several spiritual echoes seem to infuse the building. On a critical success, the creature realizes that only the most powerful force infusing the manor is evil and that the other elements are non-hostile spirits who are overwhelmed and trapped by that singular force.
entries.Success: The creature experiences a brief vision of the manor's facade twisting into an immense, horrific face and becomes {@condition frightened 1}. The creature can attempt the same {@skill Occultism} or {@skill Religion} check as above, but the DC increases to 33.
entries.Failure: As failure, but the creature becomes {@condition frightened 2} and is {@condition fleeing} for as long as it remains frightened. The creature can attempt the {@skill Occultism} or {@skill Religion} check to Recall Knowledge normally ({@dc 33}).
entries.Critical Failure: As failure, but the creature can't reduce its {@condition frightened} condition below 1 for 1 minute. In addition, the overwhelming fear causes the creature to become {@condition stupefied 1}; this condition persists until it's cured magically or the hazard is disabled.

reset: The unwelcoming facade resets immediately if not disabled and can be triggered again the very next round.

hazard.name: Weakened Floor
description: The weakened floor gives way with a tremendous crash, dropping everything in the room into a muddy morass of toxic mold.

entries: {@dc 33} {@skill Crafting} (master) three times to knock holes in the floor without triggering the spore cloud while simultaneously lightening the strain on the floor so it can be walked upon, {@dc 36} {@skill Stealth} (expert) to move carefully through the room for the remainder of your turn without triggering the hazard, or {@dc 36} {@skill Nature} (expert) twice once the trap is triggered to knock enough holes into the nearby walls to cause the spores to disperse

actions.name: Collapse Floor
actions.trigger: A round begins with a Small or larger creature standing on the floor in area A4
entries: The floor of the entire room collapses in a thunderous crash, dropping all creatures in the room 5 feet into a soupy morass of mud, mold, and toxic fungus while a cloud of spores spews up into the air above. The room becomes greater difficult terrain. All creatures who were standing on the floor in the room fall {@condition prone} in the mess below unless they succeed at a {@dc 24} Reflex save, in which case they land on their feet. The hazard then rolls initiative.

routine: (1 action) Every round on its turn, the spores that now fill area A4 inflict {@damage 8d6} poison damage to all creatures in the room ({@dc 30} basic Fortitude save) as the cloud burns at exposed flesh; a creature that holds its breath gains a +4 circumstance bonus to this saving throw.
reset: One minute after nothing moves in the room, the spores settle down. The floor remains obvious and won't collapse further, but any creature that moves through the mold causes the spores to plume up again, re-triggering the trap.

hazard.name: Witherweird Runes
description: Necromantic magic stored in runes painted in powdered bone and banshees' tears lash out at anyone other than {@creature Heh Shan-Bao|SoG3} who opens the secondary compartment.

entries: {@dc 37} {@action Disable a Device} to scratch out the runes and dissipate their magic harmlessly, {@dc 40} {@skill Arcana} to sabotage the spell and cause the runes to dry up and blow away as inert powder, or {@spell dispel magic} (7th level; {@quickref counteract|CRB|3|counteracting|0} DC 31) to counteract the runes

actions.name: Withering Wail
actions.trigger: Someone other than {@creature Heh Shan-Bao|SoG3} opens the secondary compartment
entries: A howling, spectral face manifests out of the chest and screeches, causing all within area C4 to attempt a {@dc 33} Fortitude save; the sound also alerts the {@creature provincial jiang-shi|BotD|jiang-shi} in areas C3a and C6, who quickly come to investigate the sound.

entries.Success: The creature takes {@damage 7d6} negative damage.
entries.Failure: The creature takes {@damage 15d6} negative damage. In addition, their flesh withers and weakens, leaving them to appear old and decrepit—the creature becomes {@condition clumsy 1} and {@condition enfeebled 1} until the curse is removed.
entries.Critical Failure: The creature takes {@damage 30d6} negative damage and becomes cursed as failure, but becomes {@condition clumsy 2} and {@condition enfeebled 2}.

hazard.name: Paradox Engine
description: All six sides of this adamantine-reinforced box are covered with Thassilonian runes. Touching a rune allows one to exchange its position with another.

entries: {@skill Thievery} DC 41 (expert) to feel the subtle vibrations when moving a rune to shift into the right position, or

actions.name: Thassilon Lore DC
entries: 33 (expert) or {@skill Society} DC 38 (master) while being able to read Thassilonian to work out the anagram puzzle using traditional means, or dispel magic (7th level; counteract DC 34)

actions.name: Slicing Shadows
actions.trigger: The paradox engine is damaged, or a creature fails a check to disable it
entries: Slats on the sides of the box open to release beams of razor-sharp freezing darkness that swipe throughout area C5 and extend 10 feet south into area C4; all creatures in this area who lack the {@trait Shadow} trait take {@damage 5d6} slashing damage and {@damage 5d6} cold damage (DC 34 basic Reflex save).

routine: {@as 3} ({@trait arcane}, {@trait conjuration}) The slicing shadows congeal into the form of what appears to be the upper half of a skeletal, cowled humanoid: an {@creature owb prophet|B3}. This {@creature owb prophet|B3} is a creation of the paradox engine and does not have a forsaken patron. While the {@creature owb prophet|B3} is active, the paradox engine no longer uses its Slicing Shadows reaction; instead, the {@creature owb prophet|B3} focuses its attacks on creatures that attempt to damage or deactivate the engine. If the {@creature owb prophet|B3} is destroyed, the paradox engine's disable DCs and Hardness are reduced by 5. It thereafter functions as a simple hazard with the Slicing Shadows reaction, and resets after 1 round.
reset: The paradox engine deactivates 1 minute, and its {@creature owb prophet|B3} returns to its interior after all creatures leave the area, but resets immediately thereafter.

hazard.name: Brooding Fvalthahalia

stealth.notes: check avoids triggering the hazard, but this does not disable it.

description: Tiny black flames mirror living creatures' movements in the city above as scraps of shadow patrol the streets—flames that notice intruders in their "sky" below and reach out to the intruders "above" with a deafening violence that incidentally alerts several of the vault's denizens to the intruders' presence.

entries: DC 40 {@skill Thievery} (master) to adjust the model so its attention is focused inward, DC 37 {@skill Occultism} (expert) to cause the accumulated psychic energy to discharge harmlessly, or dispel magic (7th level; counteract DC 32). A character who sneaks through the room with a DC 32

actions.name: Call of Fvalthahalia
actions.trigger: A creature without supernatural ties to the Shadow Plane enters the room (creatures like fetchlings or divine spellcasters who worship {@deity Zon-Kuthon} represent two examples of creatures who won't trigger this hazard)
entries: The flickering dark flames on the city's streets flare up and the sound of an entire city populace screaming an alarm fills the room. All creatures in area C1 take {@damage 18d6} sonic damage (DC 33 basic Fortitude save), and all strigoi from Aliriel's Vault immediately know intruders have been spotted in this room. Any strigoi in area C2 quickly investigate and attack the PCs on sight.

reset: 1 hour

hazard.name: Ileosa's Sixth Manifestation
description: Ileosa manifests as a crimson ghost and reaches out as if to receive a gift from the ritual's primary caster.

entries: {@skill Religion} DC 37 (expert) or DC 40 Occult (trained) to reverse the ritual's power.

actions.name: Queen's Laugh
actions.trigger: Someone attempts to contact Ileosa with call spirit and achieves any result other than a critical success to cast the ritual
entries: Ileosa closes her fingers and attempts to pull the primary caster's heart from their chest. The primary caster must attempt a DC 33 Fortitude save.

Success: The creature feels Ileosa's hand grip and tug at their heart; they take 25 negative damage, and then the manifestation vanishes.
Failure: As success, but the creature takes 50 negative damage and becomes {@condition drained||drained 1} as they momentarily see their heart appear in Ileosa's hand before the manifestation vanishes.
Critical Failure: The creature takes 75 negative damage and becomes {@condition drained||drained 2}. If this reduces the target to 0 Hit Points, the target dies instantly. For a brief moment, the victim's heart appears in Ileosa's hand before the manifestation vanishes. If the victim is slain by this hazard, their heart drops to the ground with a splat, pulsing its final beats after the manifestation vanishes.

hazard.name: Ileosa's Fifth Manifestation
description: Mist coils from the ground, perhaps through a sewer grate or from cracks along a basement foundation, quickly forming into the ghostly image of Queen Ileosa.

entries: DC 33 {@skill Religion} (expert) to exorcise the manifestation, or DC 36 {@skill Intimidation} (trained) to stand one's ground without showing fear.

actions.name: Queen's Laugh
actions.trigger: A living creature moves within 10 feet of where the manifestation will appear
entries: Ileosa laughs, becoming more substantial as bloody, spectral bodies appear to pile under her feet. Each living creature within 30 feet of the area must attempt a DC 30 Will save.

Success: The creature takes {@damage 5d10} mental damage as false memories of being tormented and persecuted under Ileosa's rule tear through their mind.
Failure: As above, but the creature takes {@damage 10d10} mental damage and becomes {@condition stupefied||stupefied 1} until the next sunrise from the overwhelming nature of the false memories.
Critical Failure: As failure, but the creature becomes {@condition stupefied||stupefied 2} instead. In addition, the creature continues to see dead, bloody bodies crawling from the ground during times of stress, causing them to treat all ground as difficult terrain during combat. This hallucination persists as long as the character remains {@condition stupefied} from the hazard.

hazard.name: The Enmity Cycle

stealth.notes: or {@spell detect magic}

description: Discordant music, dance, and poetry combine to build a deep suspicion and distrust of strangers.

entries: {@skill Performance} DC 26 to counteract the performance or {@skill Religion} or Occult DC 27 to disrupt the spiritual energy. Three total successes are needed to disable the trap.

actions.name: Discordant Performance
actions.trigger: Zridi spends an action to activate The Enmity Cycle while in area F2
entries: All creatures other than Zridi in F2 take {@damage 2d8+9} mental damage (DC 25 basic Will save). The trap then rolls initiative.

routine: (1 action) The performance continues to sow seeds of enmity, discord, and distrust on those in its area. All creatures in attendance other than Zridi must attempt a DC 25 Will save.

Critical Success: The target is unaffected and is immune to the effects for 1 day.
Success: The target is {@condition frightened||frightened 1} for 2 rounds.
Failure: The target is {@condition frightened||frightened 2} for 1 minute and is certain the source of this fear is their fellow citizens, especially those from places other than their hometown. For 1 week the target suffers a –2 penalty to all {@skill Diplomacy} skill checks against people from other Thuvian cities and regains the {@condition frightened||frightened 2} condition whenever they are in one of those cities.
Critical Failure: As failure, but the target becomes a carrier for The Enmity Cycle for the next week. The target is compelled to travel to a city other than where they were exposed and recite as many lines from the anbarit as they can recall. Those who hear or witness the performance are treated as if they had attended a performance of The Enmity Cycle, but the Will save DC is 23.

reset: A new production of The Enmity Cycle must be arranged; this process usually takes at least 1 week.

hazard.name: Clockwork Dancers
description: Several clockwork humanoid figures armed with spinning blades move throughout the area.

entries: {@skill Thievery} DC 25 (expert) to deactivate the clockworks from the control panel. Two successes are needed to deactivate the trap.

actions.name: Spring Attack
actions.trigger: A creature ends its turn in F2
entries: Clockwork figures spring out from the pillars and attack anyone on the stage with a spinning blade {@action Strike}.
The trap then rolls initiative.

routine: (1 action) The clockwork dancers target each creature on the stage within 10 feet of a pillar by a spinning blade {@action Strike}.
reset: The trap deactivates after 4 rounds and resets after 1 minute.

hazard.name: Corrupted Draft

stealth.notes: or {@spell detect magic}

description: Discordant music, dance, and poetry combine to build a deep suspicion and distrust of strangers.

entries: {@skill Performance} DC 28 to counteract the performance or {@skill Religion} or Occult DC 28 to disrupt the spiritual energy. Two total successes are needed to disable the trap. The mechanical head can automatically disable the trap with two uses of Inspired Recitation.

actions.name: Sickening Performance
actions.trigger: Two or more characters enter area {@b E3} and make any sound at all
entries: Sounds or speech are amplified and garbled into a terrible, shrieking cry. All creatures in the area take {@damage 2d10+11} mental damage (DC 28 basic Will save). The trap then rolls initiative.

routine: (1 action; {@trait emotion}, {@trait fear}, {@trait mental}, {@trait occult}) The echoes continue to reverberate, tearing at those in the area and filling them with distrust of others. All creatures in the area take {@damage 2d10+11} mental damage and must attempt a DC 28 Will save.

Critical Success: The target is unaffected and is immune to the effects for 1 minute.
Success: The target takes half damage.
Failure: The target takes full damage and is {@condition sickened||sickened 1} by feelings of distrust and anxiety.
Critical Failure: The target takes double damage and is {@condition sickened||sickened 2}.

reset: The hazard stops when there are no conscious creatures in area E3 and resets after 1 minute.

hazard.name: Deadly Workshop

stealth.notes: to notice the blades embedded in the chains and the complex system of pulleys connecting them

description: Swinging bladed chains whip through the entire workshop.

entries: {@skill Thievery} DC 20 (expert) on the control panel on the raised platform deactivates the trap.

notes.std: to destroy the chains and disable the trap

actions.name: Swinging Blades
actions.trigger: Two or more creatures enter the workshop or end their turn in the workshop
entries: The trap makes a slashing blade {@action Strike} against the triggering creatures, then rolls initiative.

routine: (1 action) The trap swings one slashing blade against every creature in the workshop as 1 action. The entire workshop is treated as difficult terrain because of the sheer number of slashing chains. This trap doesn't take a multiple attack penalty.
reset: The trap deactivates and resets after 1 minute.

hazard.name: Entangling Shredder Trap

stealth.notes: to notice the pressure plates under the rugs

description: Dozens of ropes embedded with steel barbs spring out from the walls when at least two creatures step on the rugs.

entries: {@skill Thievery} DC 24 (expert) on the pressure plates.

notes.std: to cut the barbed ropes and disable the trap

actions.name: Entangling Ropes
actions.trigger: Two creatures enter the hallway or end their turn in the hallway
entries: The trap makes a barbed rope {@action Strike} against the triggering creatures. This trap doesn't take a multiple attack penalty.

actions.name: Grasping Ropes
entries: The ropes whip around the limbs of the target. The target must attempt a DC 25 Reflex save.

Success: The target is unaffected.
Failure: The target is {@condition flat-footed} until it cuts the ropes or {@action Escape||Escapes} (DC 25).
Critical Failure: As failure, but the target is also {@condition immobilized}.

reset: manual

hazard.name: Mouth of Tchekuth
description: The chasm below shifts and ripples, transforming into a vast, gaping mouth filled with countless sharp fangs. A puckered, rasping tongue lances up from the noxious gulping depths below to lash and taste. Two words boom up from the vast throat below: "I Tchekuth!"

entries: DC 28 {@skill Occultism} or {@skill Religion} (to exorcise the startling phantasm)

actions.name: Hungry Tongue
actions.trigger: a creature crosses the chasm
entries: A vast, fanged maw appears to open below, and a long rasping tongue lurches up to attack the triggering creature, who must attempt a DC 24 Will save.

Critical Success: The creature realizes the haunt is a frightening phantasm that can't actually hurt them and is unharmed.
Success: The creature dodges the rasping tongue but falls from the bridge as a result, taking 10 damage from the fall (the creature can {@action Grab an Edge} with a successful DC 24 Reflex save).
Failure: For a brief moment, the creature feels the awful touch of the rasping tongue as it brushes against them, licking away memories and causing the creature to become {@condition stupefied||stupefied 1} for 24 hours. The creature then falls (as success above).
Critical Failure: The creature feels the tongue wrap around them and then experiences the awfulness of being pulled downward for what seems like days, but in fact, only an instant passes. The creature becomes {@condition stupefied||stupefied 2} for 24 hours, during which time they can't remember their name. The creature also increases the value of their {@condition malevolence|Mal} condition by 1 and then falls (as success above).

reset: The haunt resets after 24 hours and is destroyed permanently if Ioseff's ghost is put to rest.

hazard.name: Carrion Vortex
description: The countless bones and feathers on the floor churn into the air in a clattering swarm of partially reconstructed skeletal birds, whose mournful song fills the area as surely as do their slashing beaks and talons.

entries: DC 23 {@skill Nature} to convince the carrion vortex that the PCs pose no ill intent or DC 20 {@skill Religion} to exorcise the haunt

actions.name: Psychopomp Dirge
actions.trigger: Three or more creatures enter area {@b D2}, or anyone attempts to gather or destroy the bird remains
entries: The carrion vortex fills area {@b D2} with the overwhelming cries of what sounds like thousands of whippoorwills, but this cacophony can't be heard beyond this room. Creatures in area {@b D2} must attempt a DC 21Will save (worshipers of {@deity Pharasma} or those with ties to psychopomps gain a +4 circumstance bonus to this save). The haunt then rolls initiative.

Critical Success: The creature understands the dirge is also intended as a warning and a desperate request for absolution. The creature can sense the presence of the corrupted psychopomps in areas {@b D5} and {@b E4}, as if under the effects of a {@spell locate|PC1} spell, for 24 hours. As long as this effect persists, the character gains a +1 status bonus to attack rolls, saving throws, and skill checks made against the corrupted psychopomps in these areas.
Success: As critical success, but the locate effect only lasts 10 minutes. The creature takes {@damage 2d8} mental damage from overwhelming feelings of sadness and despair.
Failure: The creature takes {@damage 4d8} mental damage from overwhelming feelings of sadness and despair.
Critical Failure: The creature takes {@damage 6d8} mental damage from overwhelming feelings of sadness and despair, and as long as the haunt remains active and they remain in area {@b D2}, the character is {@condition slowed||slowed 1} as they're forced to do nothing but sob for one action every round.

routine: (1 action; {@trait evocation}, {@trait occult}) The churning vortex of beaks and bones takes its action through area {@b D2}, clawing and pecking at any creature in the area. All creatures in area {@b D2} take {@damage 2d8+9} slashing damage (DC 24 basic Reflex save).
reset: 24 hours; defeating the corrupted psychopomps in areas {@b D5} and {@b E4} destroys this haunt forever.

hazard.name: Architect and Hunter
description: A ghostly pair of teenagers—the Xarwin twins— cry out in pain as their brains are replaced into their heads. As if their trauma reverses, the initial pain fades and they express the desire to play.

entries: DC 21 {@skill Performance} (trained) to distract the haunt and entertain it until it becomes soothed or DC 25 Religion (trained) to exorcise the haunt

actions.name: Brain Pain
actions.trigger: One round passes after a living creature opens the door to either of the children's rooms
entries: Both doors to the rooms open violently as the PCs experience visions of the twins having the tops of their heads cut away by unseen blades, followed by the ghastly sight of brains being placed into the empty skulls within. All creatures in either {@b C14a}, {@b C14b}, or in the hallway outside the rooms must attempt a DC 24 Will save. The haunt then rolls initiative.

Success: The creature is {@condition sickened||sickened 1} by the pain.
Failure: The creature takes {@damage 2d8+9} mental damage and increases their {@condition malevolence|Mal} value by 1.
Critical Failure: The creature takes {@damage 4d8+9} mental damage, is {@condition stunned||stunned 1} by the pain, and increases their {@condition malevolence|Mal} value by 2.

routine: (2 actions) The architect (Mira Xarwin) uses Shackled Memories to cause a strange, house-like cage of solid ectoplasm to spring up around a randomly determined target. This house bears an uncanny resemblance to the home the target grew up in. The hunter (Marney Xarwin) then attempts a hunting shot {@action Strike} at that target.

routine.name: Shackled Memories
entries: The target believes a miniature version of their childhood home has built up around them, locking them in place. The target must attempt a DC 24 Will save.

Critical Success: The target is unaffected and is temporarily immune to Shackled Memories for 24 hours.
Success: The target is {@condition flat-footed} until the end of their next turn.
Failure: The target is {@condition flat-footed} and {@condition immobilized} until the end of their next turn.
Critical Failure: The target is {@condition restrained} for 1 minute or until they {@action Escape}.

attacks.name: hunting shot
attacks.damage: {@damage 3d8} piercing and {@damage 1d8} {@condition persistent damage||persistent mental} as the target imagines they're bleeding to death

reset: The haunt resets automatically 1 hour after it's defeated or after no living creatures remain in the area to play with. Removing Marney's and Mira's brains from the brain collector statue in area {@b E9} destroys the haunt.

hazard.name: Wrathful Hatchet

stealth.notes: darkvision

description: The hatchet embedded atop the desk wiggles, vibrates, and then flies into the air, accompanied by a rage-filled cry of a woman.

entries: DC 27 {@skill Diplomacy} to soothe the haunt's wrath or

actions.name: DC 25
entries: {@skill Religion} to exorcise the haunt

actions.name: Furious Shriek
actions.trigger: A creature approaches within 5 feet of the hatchet or more than 3 creatures enter area {@b C10}
entries: The furious shriek of Asethanna's rage resonates throughout the room, and all creatures within 25 feet of the hatchet must attempt a DC 25 Will save. The haunt then rolls initiative.

Success: The creature becomes {@condition frightened||frightened 1}.
Failure: The creature becomes {@condition frightened||frightened 2}.
Critical Failure: The creature feels as if the wrathful haunt is particularly enraged at them. The creature becomes {@condition frightened||frightened 2}; their {@condition frightened} condition doesn't decrease automatically as long as the haunt remains active, and the hatchet gains a +2 circumstance bonus to all wrathful hatchet {@action Strike||Strikes} it attempts against the creature.

routine: (3 actions; {@trait evocation}, {@trait occult}) The haunted hatchet uses an action to move to a square adjacent to a creature within 25 feet, attempts a wrathful hatchet {@action Strike} against an adjacent creature, or attempts to {@action Escape} from being {@condition immobilized} or {@condition restrained}. If there are no creatures within 25 feet, the hatchet moves in a random direction. If it ends its turn and there are no creatures within 25 feet, the hatchet falls to the ground, and the haunt ends.
reset: 24 hours; putting Xarwin's ghost to rest destroys this haunt forever.

hazard.name: Xarwin Portraits
description: The paintings suddenly start to bleed—Ioseff Xarwin from the left wrist and the other three Xarwins in a line cutting across their brows—as the viewers receive glimpses of the traumas the family endured.

entries: DC 25 {@skill Religion} to exorcise one of the paintings (a critical success exorcises all of the paintings at once) or DC 21 {@skill Thievery} to quickly cover a painting with a cloak or remove it and turn it to face the wall

actions.name: Inflict Agony
actions.trigger: At least four characters are in area {@b B22}, or someone touches or attempts to damage a painting
entries: All characters in area {@b B22} must attempt a DC 27 Will save to resist sudden, agonizing pain (the PC with the highest Intelligence feels this pain in the left wrist, while the others feel it in their heads). On a failure, a PC becomes {@condition sickened||sickened 1} from the agony ({@condition sickened||sickened 2} on a critical failure). The haunt then rolls initiative.

routine: (4 actions; {@trait emotion}, {@trait fear}, {@trait mental}, {@trait necromancy}, {@trait occult}) The haunt uses up to 4 actions to afflict bleeding wounds on different creatures in area {@b B22}. These bloody wounds manifest where the target would have felt pain from Inflict Agony, regardless of whether they succeeded in resisting that effect or not. A creature can't be targeted more than once by this routine. Each creature affected must attempt a DC 24 Fortitude save.
The haunt loses 1 action for each painting that's disabled or destroyed.

Success: The creature takes {@damage 1d8+3} slashing damage and is {@condition frightened||frightened 1} by the conviction that these wounds were caused by a loved one.
Failure: As success, but {@damage 2d8+6} slashing damage, {@damage 1d6} {@condition persistent damage||persistent bleed damage}, and {@condition frightened||frightened 2}.
Critical Failure: As failure, but {@damage 4d8+12} slashing damage, {@damage 2d6} {@condition persistent damage||persistent bleed damage}, and {@condition frightened||frightened 3}. Increase the value of the character's {@condition malevolence|Mal} condition by 1.

reset: 1 hour; putting Xarwin's ghost to rest destroys this haunt forever.

hazard.name: Lured to Ashes
description: The illusory scene of a furnished study covers the room's actual appearance. It flickers and fades, revealing a scorched and burnt chamber. A moment later, the screams of burning victims fill the room, and blazing skeletal arms reach from the ashes and charred walls to scrape and claw.

entries: DC 26 {@skill Intimidation} to command the spirits haunting this room to be silent or DC 23 {@skill Religion} to exorcise the haunt

actions.name: Lure
actions.trigger: A creature moves more than 5 feet into the room
entries: All creatures in area {@b B18} and all creatures within 10 feet of an open door or window adjacent to area {@b B18} hear a compelling voice inviting them into the room to discuss a future move back to central Cheliax. Each creature must attempt a DC 22 Will save (creatures outside of area {@b B18} gain a +2 circumstance bonus to this save). On a failure, the creature is compelled to move into area {@b B18} and be seated on one of the sofas. Creatures who succeed at the save aren't compelled and see the room as the burnt ruin that it is. The haunt then rolls initiative.

routine: (1 action; {@trait fire}, {@trait necromancy}, {@trait occult}) If there are no targets within area {@b B18} when the haunt takes its action, it can use its Lure reaction to try to get nearby victims back inside. The haunt manifests several burning skeletal arms that reach up from the ruined floors or out of the burnt walls to claw at every creature in area {@b B18}. These creatures must attempt a DC 22 Reflex save (creatures seated on a sofa take a –2 circumstance penalty to this saving throw).

Success: The creature takes {@damage 1d8} fire damage.
Failure: The creature takes {@damage 2d8} fire damage and gains weakness 5 to fire. This weakness persists until the creature is fully healed.
Critical Failure: As failure, but {@damage 4d8} fire damage and weakness 10 to fire.

reset: 8 hours; destroying the {@creature tanglebones|Mal} in area {@b E3} destroys this haunt forever.

hazard.name: Xarwin Caul
description: The Caul is a thin layer of transparent, moist webbing clinging to the manor's exterior surfaces. The stuff feels slippery and unnaturally cold to the touch, and it clings and stretches when a finger or other object used to touch the Caul is pulled away.

entries: DC 32 {@skill Occultism} (master) or DC 34 {@skill Religion} (expert) to exorcise the caul

actions.name: Burst of Hatred
actions.trigger: A creature opens any door or window into Xarwin Manor, or any creature or object passes through the caul from outside into the manor
entries: The caul immediately bursts like an oily bubble, vanishing in an instant of foul-smelling smoke. A wave of susurration creeps through the area, and all sapient creatures experience a sudden sensation of utter hatred toward birdlife for the span of a single heartbeat. All natural avians within a 300-foot emanation from Xarwin Manor (but not those within the manor or underground) take {@damage 15d6} mental damage (DC 33 basic Fortitude save).

reset: 1 week; putting Xarwin's ghost to rest permanently destroys the haunt.

hazard.name: Xarwin Manor Phantasm
description: The malevolence manifests a disturbing illusion meant to unsettle and erode intruders' resistances to the manor's dangers. Roll {@dice 1d12} on the {@table Xarwin Manor Phantasms|Mal} table to determine what sort of illusion occurs; alternatively, pick an appropriate one from the table or create one of your own using the listed results as examples or inspiration.

entries: DC 15 {@skill Occultism} or {@skill Religion} (to exorcise the disquieting phantasm)

actions.name: Haunting Vision
actions.trigger: A creature comes within 5 feet of the phantasm
entries: The disquieting phantasm creates a haunting vision. The triggering creature must attempt a DC 19 Will save.

Success: The creature is unaffected.
Failure: If the creature doesn't have the {@condition malevolence|Mal} condition, the value of its {@condition malevolence|Mal} condition increases by 1.
Critical Failure: The creature increases its {@condition malevolence|Mal} condition by 1.

hazard.name: Ghostly Choir
description: A choir of righteous {@deity Iomedae||Iomedaean} souls rises out of the floor to reclaim this space, singing an eerie chant that terrifies listeners and buffets their bodies with walls of sound.

entries: DC 28 {@skill Performance} (trained) to disrupt the song's resonance with another tune or DC 28 {@skill Religion} (trained) to ritually silence the spirits

actions.name: Profane Chant
actions.trigger: A creature enters the haunted room
entries: The choir rises, and its song deals {@damage 4d8+18} mental damage to evil creatures within 30 feet of the souls' spectral forms. Affected creatures must each attempt a DC 24 Will save.

Success: The creature takes half damage and becomes {@condition frightened||frightened 1}.
Failure: The creature takes full damage and becomes {@condition frightened||frightened 2}.
Critical Failure: The creature takes double damage. It also becomes {@condition frightened||frightened 3} and is {@condition fleeing} for 1 round.

hazard.name: Hail of Darts
description: An array of spring-loaded, ceiling-mounted darts are primed to fire down into the hallway when triggered by a pressure plate.

entries: DC 25 {@skill Thievery} (expert) on the floor tile or wall socket

actions.name: Darts
actions.trigger: Pressure is applied to the floor tile
entries: The trap shoots darts, making an attack against each creature in a 30-foot line centered on the floor tile.

attacks.name: dart
attacks.damage: {@damage 4d6+12} piercing plus old giant wasp venom

hazard.name: Boreal Rage Trap
description: A stuffed {@creature owlbear} twists toward intruders and breathes a gust of frigid air.

entries: DC 22 {@skill Thievery} (expert) on the owlbear's base

actions.name: Exhale
actions.trigger: A creature enters either of the marked areas, or a creature remains in the room for 1 minute
entries: The trap breathes cold that envelops a 15-foot burst centered on the triggering creature's square. This deals {@damage 4d8+18} cold damage (DC 24 basic Reflex save), and a creature that critically fails the save becomes {@condition clumsy||clumsy 1} for 10 minutes due to frostbite.

reset: 10 minutes

hazard.name: Poisoned Lock
description: A spring-loaded, poisoned needle is {@condition hidden} near the drawer's keyhole. Disabling or breaking the trap does not disable or break the lock.

entries: DC 23 {@skill Thievery} (expert) on the spring mechanism

actions.name: Spring
actions.trigger: A creature tries to unlock or {@action Pick a Lock||Pick the Lock}
entries: The needle extends to attack the triggering creature.

actions.name: Hunting Spider Venom
notes: The {@condition clumsy} condition caused by this venom persists for 24 hours before fading.

attacks.name: needle
attacks.damage: 1 piercing plus enhanced hunting spider venom

hazard.name: Spiritual Disruptor
description: A flickering humanoid shape with four gold eyes, clad in red robes with black sleeves and wielding a torch that burns with red fire and smoke, strides purposefully across the ground, creating distortions in reality around it that cause wood to twist and decay and send agonizing pain through the flesh.

entries: {@dc 23} (expert) {@skill Intimidation} to disrupt the haunt's concentration in the living world and break the link to the mindscape, {@skill Religion} {@dc 27} (expert) to banish the energy from the mindscape, or {@skill Occultism} {@dc 30} (expert) to turn the haunt's energy back against itself to cancel it out.

actions.name: Manifest
actions.trigger: The PCs enter or otherwise interact with the building and its contents
entries: A spiritual disruptor manifests at both locations marked {@b A4}. Both hazards then roll initiative.

routine: (3 actions) The spiritual disruptor's first action each round is always to create a pulse of rippling energy in a 10-foot emanation that causes the surrounding structure to appear to age rapidly and become distorted, causing the ground in this area to become {@quickref difficult terrain||3|terrain}. If the spiritual disruptor is adjacent to a living target, it attempts to disrupt that target's life energy by making a {@action Strike} with its smoking torch. If the spiritual disruptor isn't adjacent to a living target, it {@action stride||Strides} toward the closest target. If it has multiple adjacent targets, the spiritual disruptor favors higher-level targets, selecting randomly from multiple adjacent equal-level targets.

routine.name: Speed
entries: 20 feet

reset: If both hazards are disabled or destroyed, a new one forms adjacent to a randomly determined character still inside the crumbling building after {@dice 1d4+2} rounds. Once all three NPCs are rescued or exorcised, these hazards don't reset.

hazard.name: Manor Wards
description: Layers of fulus and strips of prayer-printed ribbons are plastered over the walls and entrances to the manor, demarcating a boundary around the mansion where no ghosts or spirits can pass.

entries: {@dc 35} {@skill Arcana}, {@skill Occultism}, or {@skill Thievery} (master) to compromise the magic to allow entry into the manor, {@dc 32} {@skill Athletics} to force your way through the barrier and enter the manor (this doesn't allow other PCs to enter behind you, though!), or {@spell dispel magic} (5th level; counteract {@dc 28}) to {@quickref counteract|CRB|3|counteracting|0} the wards

actions.name: Denied!
actions.trigger: A creature without a nullifying seal script on their hand approaches within 5 feet of the manor or attempts to damage the manor
entries: An explosive blast of magic violently slams against the intruder, who must attempt a {@dc 33} Reflex save. If the triggering creature isn't adjacent to the manor, it adjusts the result of this save up by one degree of success.

entries.Critical Success: The creature takes {@damage 1d12} force damage and is pushed 5 feet away from the manor.
entries.Success: The creature takes {@damage 2d12+13} force damage and is pushed 5 feet away from the manor
entries.Failure: The creature takes {@damage 4d12+16} force damage and is thrown 20 feet back and knocked {@condition prone}, taking 10 bludgeoning damage from the fall.
entries.Critical Failure: As failure, but 100 feet back and knocked {@condition prone}, taking 50 bludgeoning damage from the fall.

reset: The wards reset automatically, continuing to prevent entry and damaging those attempting to bypass until they're disabled.

hazard.name: Nosoi's Vengeance
description: The sparrow on the scroll animates, speaking to the PCs in Noguchi's voice (one of the {@creature nosoi||nosois} from Event 11: Nosois' Brunch): "They're the ones! They're the blasphemers who can't even properly serve tea! Send them along to the Lady!"

entries: {@dc 36} {@skill Thievery} (to quickly destroy the scroll without triggering the hazard), {@dc 33} {@skill Religion} (to apologize to {@deity Pharasma} and the {@creature nosoi||nosois} for the previous insult), or {@spell dispel magic} (6th level; {@quickref counteract|CRB|3|counteracting|0} {@dc 29}).

actions.name: Summon Vanths
actions.trigger: One of the PCs enters the room and is noticed by the hazard
entries: The trap summons four {@creature vanth|B2|vanths}, who then roll initiative and remain for up to 1 minute before the spell ends and the vanths disappear. The {@trait summoned} vanths can use 3 actions each round and can use reactions, unlike most {@trait summoned} creatures.

hazard.name: Warding Bell
description: At the heart of the shrine hangs a massive bronze temple bell.

entries: Ringing the bell as an {@action Interact} action eight times in succession with the ceremonial ringer (carried by {@creature Mago Kai|SoG3}) over the course of three consecutive rounds automatically deactivates the hazard, {@dc 36} {@skill Thievery} to extinguish the flame within the bell, {@dc 36} {@skill Religion} to appeal to {@deity Pharasma} to extinguish the flame, or {@spell dispel magic} or a {@creature shimmerthief|SoG3}'s Drain Light (6th level; {@quickref counteract|CRB|3|counteracting|0} {@dc 29})

actions.name: Flare Up
entries: The warding bell's light increases from a faint flickering to luminous enough that the whole room is brightly lit. The hazard then rolls initiative.

routine: (1 action; {@trait divine}, {@trait emotion}, {@trait enchantment}, {@trait fear}, {@trait mental}) The warding bell emits a harrowing ring that can be heard only by {@trait undead} or {@ritual transmigrate|SoG3|transmigrated} PCs in area {@b C11}; affected characters must attempt a {@dc 30} Will save.

entries.Critical Success: The creature is unaffected and is temporarily immune to the warding bell's routine for 24 hours.
entries.Success: The creature is unaffected.
entries.Failure: The creature becomes {@condition frightened 1} and takes {@damage 6d6} mental damage.
entries.Critical Failure: The creature becomes {@condition frightened 2}, takes {@damage 12d6} mental damage, and is {@condition fleeing} as long as it remains frightened.

reset: Reactivating the warding bell requires a complicated rite taking several days.

hazard.name: Explosive Manifestation
description: Reality suddenly and violently transforms, shifting from a harmless patch of terrain into something truly deadly as the mindscape draws from memories of pain and agony, revisiting old wounds.

entries: {@dc 27} {@skill Occultism} to cause the hazard to fade away without triggering it, or {@dc 30} {@skill Survival} to sense what parts of reality are in flux and to avoid the area

actions.name: Reaction
actions.trigger: A creature {@action interact||Interacts} with the hazardous object, or steps into the hazardous area
entries: A sudden blast detonates, centered on the triggering creature's square. This blast fills a 20-foot burst and inflicts {@damage 4d10+18} damage to all creatures in the area ({@dc 25} basic Reflex save). The type of damage is chosen by the GM from physical (bludgeoning or piercing), or from acid, cold, electricity, fire, or sonic. The description of how this explosion manifests should vary to match the type of damage inflicted, but should also draw from the triggering creature's past, as if memories of old wounds had suddenly come back with a vengeance. An explosive manifestation that deals piercing damage might be conveyed as a sudden blast of spikes radiating up out of the ground (stemming from a creature's memory of the time it fell into a spiked pit and almost died). One that deals fire damage might involve the sound of a dragon's roar as the air erupts into flames (coming from a creature's memory of being nearly incinerated by a dragon). A moment later, all evidence of the hazard's manifestation (save for the damage it causes to the creatures in its area) vanish.

hazard.name: Temporal Warp
description: Just as a fight begins, time suddenly seems to break in the area, causing some elements to freeze in place and others to slow down or speed up, imparting a disjointed and nightmarish sensation upon those present.

entries: {@dc 27} {@skill Occultism} to cause the hazard to fade away and release all those affected by it from the hazard's effects, or {@dc 30} {@skill Intimidation} to shock a single adjacent creature out of the distortion and free them from the hazard's effects.

actions.name: Reaction
actions.trigger: Initiative is rolled at the start of a combat where the PCs face a type of foe they have fought before
entries: As the combat begins, everything suddenly feels distorted and dreamlike. Just as in dreams, time itself seems to stretch or compress in ways that transform everything into a nightmare. All creatures within a 30-foot-burst from the first creature to act in combat must attempt a Will saving throw as, for a brief moment, time appears to stand still.

entries.Critical Success: The creature is {@condition quickened 1} for 1 minute; it can only use the extra action each round for actions with the {@trait move} trait.
entries.Success: The creature is unaffected.
entries.Failure: The creature is {@condition slowed 1} for 1 minute.
entries.Critical Failure: The creature is {@condition stunned 3} as it perceives time to have stopped entirely for it. When it recovers from the stun, it is {@condition slowed 1} for 1 minute.

hazard.name: False Victory
description: After a battle concludes, the battlefield shimmers strangely as dead bodies twitch, destroyed objects shake, and feelings of dj vu grow overwhelmingly strong.

entries: {@dc 27} {@skill Occultism} to cause the hazard to fade away before it manifests, or {@dc 30} {@skill Deception} to pretend to ignore the growing continuity break and proceed without fear, causing it to collapse in on itself.

actions.name: Reaction
actions.trigger: The PCs conclude an encounter in which a battle took place
entries: The mindscape starts to revert the results of the battle, shifting things back to the way they were at the start of the encounter. The reversion takes 1 round to complete, during which the PCs can attempt to disable the hazard or take any other actions to prepare for facing the same encounter over again. At the end of the round, the encounter resets and initiative is rolled again; all foes and environmental elements return to the condition they were in just before the fight began, but the PCs themselves do not.

hazard.name: Writhing Hair
description: A ghostly woman floats quietly through the shop, plucking hair and sending it slithering into the rafters or out to infest uncooked steamed buns.

entries: {@dc 23} {@skill Diplomacy} to calm the upset spirit down, or {@dc 21} {@skill Religion} to convince the spirit to abandon the haunting via prayer. If the PCs use Hinode Akari's name or otherwise let the haunt know that they understand her story, checks to Disable this haunt gain a +2 circumstance bonus.

actions.name: Cyclone of Hair
actions.trigger: A creature attempts to interact with or speak to the haunt
entries: The ghostly woman shrieks and rises into the air as her hair grows swiftly, snaking through the shop to tangle into the rafters or weave through the seating area. All creatures in the shop must attempt a {@dc 22} Reflex save to avoid becoming {@condition immobilized} (or {@condition restrained} on a critical failure). The haunt then rolls initiative.

routine: (1 action) The haunt targets one creature in the shop at random, preferring targets who are {@condition immobilized} or {@condition restrained}. The ghostly figure moves over to the victim and begins to strangle them with coils of her hair while she begins clawing through the target's hair as if ripping it out by the handful. The target takes {@damage 2d8+7} mental damage ({@dc 22} basic Will Save) from enduring the painful sensations of being strangled and having their hair plucked out, even though they're not actually being physically strangled or losing their hair.

hazard.name: Goh's Shame
description: A strange shadowy figure churns in the waters at Goh's feet.

entries: {@dc 21} {@skill Diplomacy} to calm Goh enough that the haunt dissipates, {@dc 23} {@skill Religion} to exorcise the haunt, or {@dc 25} {@skill Intimidation} to "scare the shame" out of Goh.

actions.name: Grasping Hands
actions.trigger: Goh steps into the Ceiba River
entries: A shadowy figure that looks like a swimming child appears to grab ahold of Goh's ankles and begins to pull him deeper into the water; Goh becomes {@condition grabbed}. The haunt then rolls initiative.

routine: (2 actions; {@trait emotion}, {@trait enchantment}, {@trait fear}, {@trait incapacitation}, {@trait mental}, {@trait occult}) The haunt uses its first action to {@action grapple} with Goh and attempts to pull him underwater. Goh has a Fortitude DC of 19. In order to pull Goh underwater, the haunt must critically succeed at its grapple check against him with a result of 29 or higher to successfully {@condition restrained||restrain} Goh. Goh is overwhelmed by terror and makes no attempt to escape, so it falls to the PCs to get him free from the haunt. If Goh is restrained and pulled underwater, the haunt must continue to grapple him in following rounds. If the haunt manages to critically succeed at grappling Goh while he's restrained, the man dies from a combination of fright and drowning, at which point the haunt immediately ends.

If Goh is pulled free and taken out of the water, the haunt loses one action and no longer attempts to grapple him. The haunt uses its second action to manifest the image of a frightening watery drowned ghost, causing one creature it targets within 30 feet to attempt a {@dc 22} Will save (the haunt always targets a creature who attempted to free Goh from its grip if possible).

entries.Success: The creature is {@condition frightened 1}.
entries.Failure: The creature is {@condition frightened 2} and {@condition fleeing} for as long as it remains frightened.
entries.Critical Failure: The creature is {@condition frightened 2} and {@condition fleeing} as long as it remains frightened, or for 1 minute, whichever comes second.

reset: The haunt ends if Goh dies and doesn't reset. If Goh is dragged out of the water, the haunt ends at the end of its next turn but resets immediately the next time Goh enters the river.

hazard.name: Kugaptee's Anger
description: The sound of toppling trees and thunderous footsteps fills the air, as if some immense giant had taken notice and now slowly approaches through the forest.

entries: {@dc 23} {@skill Nature} or {@skill Religion} to offer prayers against the evil to reduce Kugaptee's Anger's actions during its routine to 1 (see below) for 1 round; Placing Sui-Jing's heart into her corpse at area {@b A2} is the only way to disable this hazard

actions.name: Terrifying Roar
actions.trigger: A PC picks up Sui-Jing's heart
entries: A thunderous roar ripples through the forest. All of the PCs must attempt a {@dc 22} Will save. The haunt rolls initiative.

entries.Critical Success: The character is unaffected and is temporarily immune to Terrifying Roar for 24 hours.
entries.Success: The character is unaffected.
entries.Failure: The character is {@condition frightened 1}.
entries.Critical Failure: The character's frightened condition increases by 2. If this would increase the character's frightened condition value above 4, the character is instead {@condition fleeing} until the end of their next turn.

routine: (2 actions) The sound of something immense striding just out of sight through the forest, darkness,and fog fills the air. The haunt's first action is to unleash a Terrifying Roar ({@dc 22} Will with the same effects as Terrifying Roar above). The second action is to infuse the trees of the entire mindscape with malevolent life, causing clawlike branches to lash out at each PC. These claws inflict {@damage 4d6} slashing damage ({@dc 22} basic Reflex save) to each character. A character standing on the path or in a clearing gets a +1 circumstance bonus to this saving throw, and the character who carries Sui-Jing's heart gains a +4 item bonus to this saving throw. On a PC's turn, they can take further action to protect themselves from the clawed branches. By {@action raise a shield||Raising a Shield} or by {@action drop prone||Dropping Prone}, a PC gains a +2 circumstance bonus to their Reflex saving throw. A {@condition prone} PC can {@action Take Cover} to gain the benefits of {@quickref greater cover|CRB|3|cover|0} against the claws (increasing their circumstance bonus to this Reflex save to +4). A PC who {@action tumble through||Tumbles Through} on their turn and succeeds at a {@dc 22} Acrobatics check gains a +2 status bonus to their Reflex saves against the clawed branches. A PC who succeeds at a {@dc 22} {@skill Stealth} check to {@action Sneak} improves the result of their Reflex save by one degree of success.

If a PC successfully used {@skill Nature} or {@skill Religion} to pray against the evil on the previous round, Kugaptee's Anger has only 1 action; randomly determine if it uses its Terrifying Roar or lashes out with trees with this action.

hazard.name: Arms of the Drowned

stealth.notes: to catch glimpses of ghostly figures drowning in the water below.

description: Ghostly arms rise up from the water to clutch and grab, while a geyser of leech-infested water sprays up into the central shrine.

entries: {@dc 20} {@skill Religion} to offer prayers to calm the haunt, or {@dc 23} {@skill Intimidation} to threaten the unquiet spirits away

actions.name: Rising Waters
actions.trigger: A creature swims more than halfway across the river, ends their turn in the bridge shrine, or sets foot onto the northern bridge
entries: Ghostly arms rise up from the river to grab and shake both bridges. Creatures standing on the bridge must attempt a {@dc 20} Reflex save or be knocked {@condition prone}. A blast of river water sprays up inside the shrine to deposit two {@creature brood leech swarm|B2|brood leech swarms} in the shrine. The haunt and the leech swarms then roll initiative.

routine: (3 actions) Ghostly arms flail about and attempt to grab creatures in the shrine or on either bridge. Each round, the haunt uses 3 actions to attempt to {@action grapple} a PC on the bridge or in the shrine. If a PC is {@condition restrained}, the haunt can use one of its actions to drag a PC into the river. A PC who's restrained in the river risks {@quickref drowning|CRB|3|drowning and suffocating|0}.
reset: The haunt deactivates and resets at the start of any round in which the PCs aren't in the river, on the bridges, or in the shrines, but the leech swarms remain in the shrine for 10 minutes before retreating back into the water below.

hazard.name: Fiendish Reflection
description: Reflections viewed in the water here appear monstrous and fiendish.

entries: {@dc 20} {@skill Religion} to exorcise the haunt, or {@dc 23} {@skill Intimidation} to turn the fear back on the haunt and overwhelm it

actions.name: Frightening Visage
actions.trigger: A creature looks at the water
entries: The creature sees its reflection on the water's surface distort into a fiendish version of themselves; they must succeed at a {@dc 20} Will save or become {@condition frightened 2} (and {@condition fleeing} for as long as they remain frightened on a critical failure).

reset: The haunt resets immediately and can trigger again the next round.

hazard.name: Kugaptee's Tree
description: The branches of the stone tree statue animate, extend, and lash out at intruders.

entries: {@dc 25} {@skill Religion} to exorcise the haunt, or {@dc 28} {@skill Intimidation} to appear overwhelmingly strong of body and mind

actions.name: Pulse of Fear
actions.trigger: An intruder to the monastery begins their turn in area E3
entries: The stone statue lurches to life, its branches whipping through the air as a horrifying roar rips through the monastery—a roar that seems to come from underground. All intruders within the monastery must attempt a {@dc 21} Will save. The haunt then rolls initiative.

entries.Success: The creature is {@condition frightened 1}.
entries.Failure: The creature is {@condition frightened 2}.
entries.Critical Failure: The creature is frightened 2 and {@condition fleeing} for as long as it remains frightened.

routine: (3 actions) Kugaptee's tree lashes out with its branches, using its three actions to attempt branch {@action strike||Strikes} against any creature in reach. Targets that are within reach but are outside of area {@b E3} have {@quickref cover|CRB|3|cover|0} from the surrounding archways. The haunt favors targets in area {@b E3} but otherwise selects its targets randomly.
reset: 1 hour

hazard.name: Unholy Hunger
description: A miasma of foul-smelling vapor with shrieking faces barely visible in the steam bubbles up from the soup.

entries: {@dc 19} {@skill lore||Cooking Lore} to neutralize the haunted stew with the addition of a few select spices from nearby shelves, or {@dc 25} {@skill Religion} to exorcise the haunt

actions.name: Worse Than It Smells
actions.trigger: A non-{@trait nindoru|SoG2} creature takes the lid off the cooking pot
entries: All creatures within 15 feet of the pot must succeed at a {@dc 27} Fortitude save or become {@condition sickened 2}. The triggering creature instead must attempt a {@dc 24} Will save to resist the compulsion to dip their face into the stew and swallow a mouthful of the stuff (this effect has the {@trait enchantment} and {@trait mental} traits). On a failure, the triggering creature takes {@damage 5d6} poison damage ({@dc 24} basic Fortitude save).

reset: The haunt resets 1 round after the lid is replaced on the cooking pot.

hazard.name: Grasping Currents

stealth.notes: to notice a weird, faintly glowing ripple of the current beneath the water.

description: A swath of drowned spirits tries to pull someone down into the water to join them.

entries: DC 23 {@skill Religion} to calm the unquiet spirits in the waters for an hour, or light the Eternal Lantern (automatically disables the haunt)

actions.name: Ghostly Grasp
actions.trigger: A creature attempts to cross the lake by {@action swim||swimming} or piloting a boat
entries: Ghostly arms reach up to grab and clutch at the creature or the boat, causing a –2 penalty to the {@skill Athletics} or {@skill lore||Piloting} check that triggered the haunt. The haunt then rolls initiative.

routine: (1 action) On its initiative, the grasping currents attempt to {@action Grapple} a swimming creature or capsize a rowboat by attempting an {@skill Athletics} check with a {@dice 1d20+12|+12|Athletics} modifier. A creature that's {@condition restrained} by the grasping currents is pulled underwater and risks drowning. To capsize a rowboat, the haunt's {@skill Athletics} check is rolled against the pilot's {@skill Athletics} or {@skill lore||Sailing Lore} DC, whichever is higher.
reset: The grasping currents quickly build up power and can trigger again after 10 minutes have passed.

hazard.name: Haphazard Wood Pile

stealth.notes: to notice how the pile might fall on a person disabling it; DC 0 to see the pile.

description: Beams of heavy and sharp wood rest against one another to form a precariously balanced cage tied to several trip lines and tension-bearing dowels.

entries: DC 17 {@skill Thievery} (trained), {@skill Crafting} (trained), or {@skill Lore||Engineering Lore} (trained) to figure out how to safely dismantle the pile without it collapsing on anyone.

actions.name: Collapse Inward
actions.trigger: Any of the four revelers within the hazard perform any action with the {@trait move} trait
entries: The pile collapses onto the four revelers, dealing {@dice 1d6+5} bludgeoning damage (DC 17 basic Reflex save) to each of them. All four also take {@dice 1d6} {@condition persistent damage||persistent bludgeoning} damage until they're pulled from the rubble with a DC 17 {@skill Athletics} check or can {@action Escape} (DC 17).

actions.name: Collapse Outward
actions.trigger: An attempt to disable the hazard from outside critically fails, or the hazard is intentionally triggered by someone from outside of the wood pile
entries: The pile collapses outward, inflicting {@dice 1d6+5} bludgeoning damage to the four revelers (DC 15 basic Reflex save), and {@dice 2d6+5} bludgeoning damage (DC 17 basic Reflex save) to all creatures in a 10-foot area surrounding the central 10-foot-square where the revelers were trapped.

hazard.name: Scholar's Bane

stealth.notes: to notice magical sensors {@condition hidden} within four of the carvings' eyes

description: Illusion magic overwhelms the minds of particularly intelligent creatures, forcing them to relive every intellectual failure and shame they've ever suffered.

entries: DC 22 {@skill Thievery} (trained) to carve out one eye sensor, DC 22 {@skill Arcana} or {@skill Occultism} (trained) to blank out one's mind (disables trap for self only), or {@spell dispel magic} (2nd level; counteract DC 20) to counteract one eye sensor

actions.name: Reveal Failurs
actions.trigger: A creature with an Intelligence score of 10 or greater enters the room
entries: The trap fills the triggering creature's mind with shameful memories. The creature must succeed at a DC 22 Will save or take {@damage 2d8+2} mental damage. The trap then rolls initiative.

routine: (4 actions) The trap uses each action to target a creature in the room with an Intelligence score of 10 or greater. A target must succeed at a DC 22 Will save or take {@damage 2d8+2} mental damage. On a critical failure, the creature takes a –10-foot status penalty to Speed for 1 minute as they stagger under the weight of their failures. The trap loses 1 action for each eye sensor disabled or destroyed.
reset: The trap can function for 10 rounds, which don't need to be consecutive, before it must recharge for 24 hours.

hazard.name: Reservoir Trap
